title: ActionView::Helpers::Tags::Select's group_choices detection can unknowingly end up calling the `second` method
body:
### Steps to reproduce

```ruby
# frozen_string_literal: true

require "bundler/inline"

gemfile(true) do
  source "https://rubygems.org"

  gem "rails", "8.0.2"
  # If you want to test against edge Rails replace the previous line with this:
  # gem "rails", github: "rails/rails", branch: "main"

  gem "sqlite3"
end

require "active_record/railtie"
require "action_view/railtie"
require "minitest/autorun"

# This connection will do for database-independent bug reports.
ENV["DATABASE_URL"] = "sqlite3::memory:"

class TestApp < Rails::Application
  config.load_defaults Rails::VERSION::STRING.to_f
  config.eager_load = false
  config.logger = Logger.new($stdout)
  config.secret_key_base = "secret_key_base"

  config.active_record.encryption.primary_key = "primary_key"
  config.active_record.encryption.deterministic_key = "deterministic_key"
  config.active_record.encryption.key_derivation_salt = "key_derivation_salt"
end
Rails.application.initialize!

ActiveRecord::Schema.define do
  create_table :posts, force: true do |t|
  end
end

class Post < ActiveRecord::Base
end

class BugTest < ActionView::TestCase
  def test_stuff

    render inline: <<~ERB, locals: { options: [Post] }
      <%= select(nil, "class", options) %>
    ERB

    assert_equal "Post", Post.to_s
    assert_equal <<~HTML, rendered.to_s
      <select name="class" id="class"><option value="Post">Post</option></select>
    HTML
  end
end
```

### Expected behavior

Since I'm passing a unidimensional array, I would expect:
1. The helper to not detect that I'm passing group_choices
2. To render my option of Class type using `to_s`

See the test above

### Actual behavior

[`group_choices?`](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/22a61df687a5408a37ed0b9dcf73c08b250dc9be/actionview/lib/action_view/helpers/tags/select.rb#L39-L40) ends up calling [`Post.second`](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/22a61df687a5408a37ed0b9dcf73c08b250dc9be/activerecord/lib/active_record/querying.rb#L7), triggering a DB load, resulting in a nil object:

```
I, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.508624 #88242]  INFO -- : -------------------
I, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.508650 #88242]  INFO -- : BugTest: test_stuff
I, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.508658 #88242]  INFO -- : -------------------
D, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.516487 #88242] DEBUG -- :   Rendering inline template
D, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.523872 #88242] DEBUG -- :   [1m[36mPost Load (0.1ms)[0m  [1m[34mSELECT "posts".* FROM "posts" ORDER BY "posts"."id" ASC LIMIT ? OFFSET ?[0m  [["LIMIT", 1], ["OFFSET", 1]]
D, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.526037 #88242] DEBUG -- :   [1m[36mPost Load (0.1ms)[0m  [1m[34mSELECT "posts".* FROM "posts" ORDER BY "posts"."id" ASC LIMIT ?[0m  [["LIMIT", 1]]
D, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.527187 #88242] DEBUG -- :   [1m[36mPost Load (0.0ms)[0m  [1m[34mSELECT "posts".* FROM "posts" ORDER BY "posts"."id" DESC LIMIT ?[0m  [["LIMIT", 1]]
I, [2025-04-24T09:23:50.527786 #88242]  INFO -- :   Rendered inline template (Duration: 10.8ms | GC: 0.0ms)

  1) Failure:
BugTest#test_stuff [bug.rb:53]:
--- expected
+++ actual
@@ -1,2 +1,2 @@
-"<select name=\"class\" id=\"class\"><option value=\"Post\">Post</option></select>
+"<select name=\"class\" id=\"class\"><option selected=\"selected\" value=\"\"></option></select>
 "
```

If the table isn't defined, it's even worse, it crashes with `no such table: posts:`

I understand that calling the form helper with a Class may not be supported, but I don't think the form helper should be calling `.second` without checking the type first.

### System configuration

**Rails version**: 
8.0.2

**Ruby version**: 
3.3.4
